name: Hotel II Castillas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at Puerto Del Sol about 11pm and asked a local taxi where thehotel was ..... never heard of it!! Asked the next driver, again never heard of it! This happened about 6/7 times and that was with showing people the name and address on paper! Eventually a taxi took us to the hotel, but even then he was unsure of location! Next day we realised how close we were to Puerto del Sol but astounded that not one person could locate the hotel!!
reviews.title: Nobody ever heard of it???!!!!

reviews.text: Like others here I booked this hotel on the basis of its Trip advisor No.1 ranking. I noticed just before I departed for Madrid it had slipped down to number 19 and is now even further down the ranking. I would have to say that I agree that it should never have been no.1. The hotel in itself is functional and clean and situated in a perfectly central area for seeing the sights etc. Most of the staff seemed fine and perfectly adequate, polite and professional. The problem for us was the the organisation in the breakfast room which I thought was nothing short of chaotic at times. There did not seem to be any proper supervision there. They were constantly running out of utensils such as spoons, knives and forks, plates, cups etc. The layout of the buffet area was such that you were in danger of often bumping into other guests who were moving in all directions round this area to to try and get their food which also quite often seemed to be running out causing delays.All in all it was really badly organised to the extent that on a number of days we just did not bother going. Left us a bit disappointed really.
reviews.title: Very disappointing. Definitely not #1.

reviews.title: Great value in Madrid
reviews.text: After some of the other hotels we stayed in during our nine city tour of Spain, I was initially disappointed with the small, dark, spartan room. The location on Abada Street (which means rhinoceros in Spanish!) is just off the Gran Via and Carmen St. It is a short walk to the major plazas, restaurants and stores. We did not take the Metro but understand that that is a convenient option. We did walk and took a few cab rides. We eventually realized that the II Castillas is a good value for the price: clean, quiet, good AC, and boasting excellent security. The security is definitely needed because there is a major "street of prostitution" one small block away! The hotel is locked at night and you have to be buzzed in to enter. One small complaint is that the lobby lights are dimmed to semi-darkness at night. I don't know if this is an energy saver or a feeble attempt to create atmosphere. Occassionally it took a long time for hot water to come to the sink. We had a full enclosure around our shower so the typical water-in-the-floor was not an issue. The busy staff was helpful in finding us a large taxi to take 4 people & lots of baggage to the airport. There is a large coin-op internet cafe just around the corner, so you can check your email. Great value for 113 euros a night.

We stayed in the Hotel II Castillas for 5 nights in early May. It is located on a small side street near the Gran Via. Only a short walk to a metro, Plaza Del Carmen and Pureta Del Sol. There is shopping and restaurants in every direction. The rooms are small but very clean and well kept. The bathroom has two sinks, magnifying mirror, hair dryer and a tight corner shower. reviews.text: We were wary when this hotel dropped from No 1 on TA to somewhere in the 60's. No need for concern. Our twin room was immaculate and a reasonable size with street view (Rm 403) - the doubles looked smaller/darker. Large bathroom, powerful shower and a bath, hairdryer. Air con and comfy enough beds. The breakfast was fab - hams, cheeses, fruit, juices, yoghurts smoked salmon, scrambled eggs etc. The only downside was the AWFUL 'classical'!? muzak which played all through breakfast. Turn it off please!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS: First, the location is fabulous. We were about 2-3 "blocks" away from Puerta del Sol (there's a metro stop there), shopping, and tons of awesome tapas bars. The hotel itself is on a little side street with minimal traffic, so we never heard any street noise AT ALL...which is rare in a hotel in Madrid. The room we had was HUGE! Again, a big surprise. We booked a double room, and were given a corner room with (a) a view, (b) a king-size bed, and (c) an enormous bathroom with plenty of toiletry samples. We stayed there for an additional night after returning from five days in Sevilla, and we asked to be given a corner room again since we loved the first one so much. The gave it to us, and that one even had a bathtub! I didn't even know 3-star hotels in Europe had rooms with bathtubs in the bathrooms. The breakfast they serve downstairs is awesome...pastrys, cold cuts, chorizo, breads, fruit, cereals, and fresh cheeses. Loved it!
reviews.title: Excellent Location

likes.disliked: — No tea /coffee facilities in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CONS: Really, there weren't many at all. The bed was on the hard side, but I think most hotel beds in the 2- to 3-star range in Europe are like that. The staff was friendly enough, but not what I could call overly warm and gracious...very formal. I read in other reviews that the hotel can be hard to find. We took a taxi to the hotel several times (always with a Google map of it just in case), and our drivers never had a problem with it. However, if you come from the Metro with your luggage, have a good Google map because it is a little out of the way.

description: Hotel II Castillas is located in the heart of Madrid, exactly between Gran Via Street and Preciados Street.Recently opened. It´s the perfect hotel if you want to visit the center of the city. Ideal either for business or leisure. Main museums 12 minutes away! Right next to metro and bus stations. All of our rates have breakfast included. FREE WIFI!!!
